boat.name: Peggotty
boat.full_description: Peggotty was semi derelict in c.1975 on the East Coast of England and then had an engine installed during a major refit. She was converted to cutter and redecked in 2000, with mizzen tabernacle fitted. 4-berth, arranged in main and forward cabin, with oven, heater and toilet. Keel and frame in oak, hull planking in pitch pine (larch) on oak frames, cabin in pine, teak and oak. 2-cylinder air-cooled Lister diesel engine, reconditioned in 1998. Some 6.5 tons out of the water.
boat.construction_details: Double diagonal Larch on oak, four berth outfitted in pine oak and teak
boat.short_description: Peggotty is 27' overall length (excluding bowsprit) drawing 3' 8'' draft. Built by N. Nisbet, Newcastle on Tyne, in 1930.
